Method Detail

indexFromRemote

public java.lang.String indexFromRemote(java.lang.String config,
                                        java.lang.String data,
                                        java.lang.String extension)
Index file(s) on the server into an index on the server using the settings in a string

Parameters:
config - String containing the indexconfig xml
extension - Extension of the data (to associate the filetype)
data - data to be indexed on the server
Returns:
status string

addToIndex

public java.lang.String addToIndex(java.lang.String filedata,
                                   java.lang.String filename,
                                   java.lang.String indexName)
Add files to index on a server

Parameters:
indexName - name of the index
filename - filename to use for the data
filedata - data to be indexed on the server
Returns:
status string

indexFromCFG

public java.lang.String indexFromCFG(java.lang.String configfile,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String dataPath)
Index file(s) on the server into an index on the server using the settings from a configfile

Parameters:
configfile - Path to configfile on the server
name - Name of the index to use/create
dataPath - Path to the files to be indexed on the server
Returns:
status string

public java.lang.String index(java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String dataPath)
Index file(s) on the server into an index on the server using default settings

Parameters:
name - Name of the index to use/create
dataPath - Path to the files to be indexed on the server
Returns:
status string

public java.lang.String indexFromSRB(java.lang.String userName,
                                     java.lang.String password,
                                     java.lang.String fromPath)
Index file(s) from SRB into an index on the server using default settings

Parameters:
userName - SRB username
password - SRB password
fromPath - Path to the files to be indexed on SRB
Returns:
status string

indexWithTCP

public java.lang.String indexWithTCP(java.lang.String streamingConfig,
                                     java.lang.String extension)
Index file(s) from a TCP stream into an index on the server using settings included in the beginning of the stream

Parameters:
streamingConfig - the TCP stream configurations, e.g. port
extension - not used
Returns:
indexed files

indexWithSOAP

public java.lang.String indexWithSOAP(java.lang.String indexConfig,
                                      java.lang.String content,
                                      java.lang.String fileName)
Index file(s) from a SOAP message. You may call this method with an existing file name in the index, if you want to append content

Parameters:
indexConfig - the index configuration as a String
extension - the content
Returns:
indexed files

indexWithSwA

public java.lang.String indexWithSwA(java.lang.String indexConfig)
Index file(s) from a SOAP attachment. You may call this method with an existing file name in the index, if you want to append content

Parameters:
indexConfig - the index configuration as a String
Returns:
indexed files

streamContent

public java.lang.String streamContent(java.lang.String streamingConfig,
                                      java.lang.String indexConfig,
                                      java.lang.String dir,
                                      java.lang.String endPoint,
                                      int method,
                                      boolean generateContent)
Extracts content from a PDF file, and strams it in the service listening at endPoint

Parameters:
streamingConfig - the stream configuration as a String
dir - the location of the PDF folder or file
endPoint - the location where the service listening at.
method - what method should it be used for straming the contenet (HTTP,SOAP,etc.)
generateContent - used for testing. It generates a txt content.
Returns:
files stramed

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Use the file indexconfig.xml to configure!

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
